story.title: #VikingsLive

author.name: British Museum
author.bio: A museum of the world, for the world.

image.caption: We’re excited about #VikingsLive tomorrow with @Bettany_Hughes and Michael Wood. We’ll be live tweeting from 19.00! http://t.co/c3XWw1ZER5

quote.text: We’re excited about #VikingsLive tomorrow with @Bettany_Hughes and Michael Wood. We’ll be live tweeting from 19.00! http://t.co/c3XWw1ZER5

image.caption: Got a question for #VikingExhibition Curator Gareth? Tweet it to us and he’ll answer some during #VikingsLive! http://t.co/NBUIrap5F0

quote.text: Got a question for #VikingExhibition Curator Gareth? Tweet it to us and he’ll answer some during #VikingsLive! http://t.co/NBUIrap5F0

image.caption: Going to #VikingsLive tomorrow? Dress up as a Viking and you could win prizes! More here http://t.co/YREzSNcRWg http://t.co/EiWkTEhTSh

quote.text: Going to #VikingsLive tomorrow? Dress up as a Viking and you could win prizes! More here http://t.co/YREzSNcRWg http://t.co/EiWkTEhTSh

image.caption: What’s that on the horizon? Read presenter Michael Wood's blog ahead of #VikingsLive tomorrow http://t.co/WkHN9KFqrk http://t.co/1syibytkmw

quote.text: What’s that on the horizon? Read presenter Michael Wood's blog ahead of #VikingsLive tomorrow http://t.co/WkHN9KFqrk http://t.co/1syibytkmw
Good luck @britishmuseum with #VikingsLive today! We can't wait to bring Matisse to cinemas worldwide #MatisseLive! http://t.co/mUTkcj51BQ

image.caption: At 7pm tonight cinema will come to life on Twitter as @britishmuseum live-tweet the world première of #VikingsLive http://t.co/t1vPFUvyAN

quote.text: At 7pm tonight cinema will come to life on Twitter as @britishmuseum live-tweet the world première of #VikingsLive http://t.co/t1vPFUvyAN
Good luck to our neighbours and #MuseumMileLDN friends @britishmuseum for tonight's #VikingsLive show, beamed live to cinemas across the UK!
Looking forward to seeing #VikingsLive at @CityScreenYork tonight. Must comb the beard...

image.caption: The crew are preparing for tonight’s #VikingsLive! Will you be invading your local cinema? http://t.co/gfUAKkeGfu http://t.co/wTyqmfhAFW

quote.text: The crew are preparing for tonight’s #VikingsLive! Will you be invading your local cinema? http://t.co/gfUAKkeGfu http://t.co/wTyqmfhAFW

image.caption: My #VikingsLive accessories to accompany mythical cloak. Bag of runes, #Valkyrie & #Thoe talisman, Yggdrasil satchel. http://t.co/jpVXFVi2aL

quote.text: My #VikingsLive accessories to accompany mythical cloak. Bag of runes, #Valkyrie & #Thoe talisman, Yggdrasil satchel. http://t.co/jpVXFVi2aL

image.caption: Follow @britishmuseum as they live-tweet their #VikingsLive exhibition when it takes over cinemas nationwide from 7pm http://t.co/bwpViV5Zd0

quote.text: Follow @britishmuseum as they live-tweet their #VikingsLive exhibition when it takes over cinemas nationwide from 7pm http://t.co/bwpViV5Zd0

image.caption: One hour to go until #VikingsLive @britishmuseum . These are the serious bods in OB truck. Good luck one and all! http://t.co/m1PzDQkxM7

quote.text: One hour to go until #VikingsLive @britishmuseum . These are the serious bods in OB truck. Good luck one and all! http://t.co/m1PzDQkxM7

image.caption: En route to the cinema with Lesley Smith and the office girls to see @britishmuseum film! #vikingsrule http://t.co/GoCwfVo8VS

quote.text: En route to the cinema with Lesley Smith and the office girls to see @britishmuseum film! #vikingsrule http://t.co/GoCwfVo8VS

image.caption: Join us here at 19.00 when we'll be live tweeting #VikingsLive from the Museum http://t.co/btt4wABRF6

quote.text: Join us here at 19.00 when we'll be live tweeting #VikingsLive from the Museum http://t.co/btt4wABRF6

image.caption: The countdown to #VikingsLive has commenced! @britishmuseum #VikingsRule http://t.co/x5KOdRvC2G

quote.text: The countdown to #VikingsLive has commenced! @britishmuseum #VikingsRule http://t.co/x5KOdRvC2G

image.caption: Here's Bjarni ready for the @britishmuseum #VikingsLive broadcast at @vuecinemas in #Carlisle #VikingsRule http://t.co/Hu9bjy9x6c

quote.text: Here's Bjarni ready for the @britishmuseum #VikingsLive broadcast at @vuecinemas in #Carlisle #VikingsRule http://t.co/Hu9bjy9x6c
#VikingsLive will be around 90 minutes long and we will be live tweeting throughout!

image.caption: ...and we're live! Check out #VikingsLive to follow along and for extra info (but please don't tweet in the cinema!) http://t.co/dWJqLUR8UO

quote.text: ...and we're live! Check out #VikingsLive to follow along and for extra info (but please don't tweet in the cinema!) http://t.co/dWJqLUR8UO

image.caption: Michael Wood welcomes everyone to #VikingsLive – a private view of the show of the season, #VikingExhibition http://t.co/tNTfxvkA5G

quote.text: Michael Wood welcomes everyone to #VikingsLive – a private view of the show of the season, #VikingExhibition http://t.co/tNTfxvkA5G

image.caption: .@Bettany_Hughes says #VikingsLive will bring us up to date with the latest discoveries, challenging what we know http://t.co/kELuUlFx0L

quote.text: .@Bettany_Hughes says #VikingsLive will bring us up to date with the latest discoveries, challenging what we know http://t.co/kELuUlFx0L
The #VikingExhibition has been years in the planning with @smbmuseum in Berlin and @Nationalmuseet in Denmark #VikingsLive

image.caption: It includes over 1,000 objects from London, Berlin and Copenhagen, and from all over the UK and Europe #VikingsLive http://t.co/ThCtVgnQk5

quote.text: It includes over 1,000 objects from London, Berlin and Copenhagen, and from all over the UK and Europe #VikingsLive http://t.co/ThCtVgnQk5

image.caption: Queen Margrethe II of Denmark opened #VikingExhibition – she’s a direct descendant of Harald Bluetooth! #VikingsLive http://t.co/RRhXmgi1ut

quote.text: Queen Margrethe II of Denmark opened #VikingExhibition – she’s a direct descendant of Harald Bluetooth! #VikingsLive http://t.co/RRhXmgi1ut
Neil MacGregor: #VikingExhibition is not just the Viking world, but the world in the Viking Age #VikingsLive

image.caption: Over 1,000 years ago Vikings travelled to 4 continents #VikingsLive http://t.co/BKXzX5f2hi http://t.co/xMf6X1n5pA

quote.text: Over 1,000 years ago Vikings travelled to 4 continents #VikingsLive http://t.co/BKXzX5f2hi http://t.co/xMf6X1n5pA

image.caption: The Viking world was enormous – from central Asia to North America, from the Arctic Circle to Morocco #VikingsLive http://t.co/WtGa0Gdtup

quote.text: The Viking world was enormous – from central Asia to North America, from the Arctic Circle to Morocco #VikingsLive http://t.co/WtGa0Gdtup
Neil's favourite object in #VikingExhibition is a silver figure, thought to be Odin, sitting on a throne

image.caption: Odin is associated with war and conquest, wisdom and magic, poetry and prophecy #VikingsLive http://t.co/ztQwnRYvWH

quote.text: Odin is associated with war and conquest, wisdom and magic, poetry and prophecy #VikingsLive http://t.co/ztQwnRYvWH

image.caption: We think it’s Odin as he is flanked by two ravens Huginn and Muninn – Thought and Memory #VikingsLive http://t.co/vX6uPqcrE4

quote.text: We think it’s Odin as he is flanked by two ravens Huginn and Muninn – Thought and Memory #VikingsLive http://t.co/vX6uPqcrE4

image.caption: #VikingExhibition is the first in the Museum’s new Sainsbury Exhibitions Gallery #VikingsLive http://t.co/Y9uNVlwTld

quote.text: #VikingExhibition is the first in the Museum’s new Sainsbury Exhibitions Gallery #VikingsLive http://t.co/Y9uNVlwTld

image.caption: It’s the first exhibition on Vikings at the Museum for over 30 years, so there are many new discoveries #VikingsLive http://t.co/JschLkTDXV

quote.text: It’s the first exhibition on Vikings at the Museum for over 30 years, so there are many new discoveries #VikingsLive http://t.co/JschLkTDXV

image.caption: One of these is Roskilde 6 – discovered in 1996, it’s the longest Viking warship ever found #VikingsLive http://t.co/4NHA3ID7Le

quote.text: One of these is Roskilde 6 – discovered in 1996, it’s the longest Viking warship ever found #VikingsLive http://t.co/4NHA3ID7Le
The reconstructed ship’s length meant we wouldn’t have been able to display it without the new gallery! #VikingsLive

image.caption: The original Viking homelands were in what is now Norway, Denmark, Sweden and Finland #VikingsLive http://t.co/f16OGFpujE

quote.text: The original Viking homelands were in what is now Norway, Denmark, Sweden and Finland #VikingsLive http://t.co/f16OGFpujE
They were fragmented by water, so travel by river, fjord and sea was much easier than by land #VikingsLive
Vikings are not one single ethnic group – in Old Norse 'Vikingr' meant a pirate or raider #VikingsLive

image.caption: Pirate, raider or trader, the ship was vital – the exhibition opens with a Viking ship brooch #VikingsLive http://t.co/DHNkghpi7X

quote.text: Pirate, raider or trader, the ship was vital – the exhibition opens with a Viking ship brooch #VikingsLive http://t.co/DHNkghpi7X
Ships were central to Viking society and appear in Viking jewellery, models, toys and even graffiti #VikingsLive
Viking decoration went well beyond ships, into the world of dragons, trolls and gods http://t.co/OedMzKRkAJ

image.caption: Prof Neil Price: the best way to get inside a Viking's head is through a Viking burial #VikingsLive http://t.co/GnegkCihrE

quote.text: Prof Neil Price: the best way to get inside a Viking's head is through a Viking burial #VikingsLive http://t.co/GnegkCihrE
You can read Neil Price’s blog about Viking death and burial here http://t.co/JZFVtt7lVg #VikingsLive
The objects in graves are what those burying the dead thought appropriate, not the treasured possessions of the deceased #VikingsLive
Even ironing boards have been discovered in Viking burials! #VikingsLive
Neil Price: it’s hard to say what boat burial ‘meant’ – transport to another world or just your most expensive possession? #VikingsLive
Silence falls as a torch-lit Viking burial starts to take place in the grounds of the Museum #VikingsLive
The Vikings began with small vessels, but later built large vessels that navigated the wildest seas powered by sail and oar #VikingsLive
Cinema audiences are seeing their first glimpse on the screen of the warship in the #VikingExhibition

image.caption: Roskilde 6 is the longest Viking warship ever found – it would have carried 100 men, with 80 oarsmen #VikingsLive http://t.co/YTQWiL8YH7

quote.text: Roskilde 6 is the longest Viking warship ever found – it would have carried 100 men, with 80 oarsmen #VikingsLive http://t.co/YTQWiL8YH7
The ship was found by accident in 1996 when workers were excavating the harbour next to the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde #VikingsLive

image.caption: Kristiane Strætkvern explains how dendrochronology has revealed the ship was built in Norway in 1035 #VikingsLive http://t.co/pEYv2ph4fB

quote.text: Kristiane Strætkvern explains how dendrochronology has revealed the ship was built in Norway in 1035 #VikingsLive http://t.co/pEYv2ph4fB
We can also tell that repairs were made in the Baltic area in 1039 #VikingsLive
Kristiane shows how Roskilde 6 was installed in #VikingExhibition in this behind-the-scenes video #VikingsLive http://t.co/U5o5Hbb9ga
Fun fact: we get the word ‘starboard’ from Old Norse. Steersmen sat at the back of the ship on one side – the steerisbord #VikingsLive

image.caption: A team from @TheNMMC have built a section of a Viking ship so we can see the distinctive build and shape #VikingsLive http://t.co/DuszQ9hRzM

quote.text: A team from @TheNMMC have built a section of a Viking ship so we can see the distinctive build and shape #VikingsLive http://t.co/DuszQ9hRzM
You can read Mike Selwood’s blog about building a Viking boat today http://t.co/VUPYfpUUYj #VikingsLive

image.caption: Roskilde’s Viking Ship Museum built a 60-ft ship in 18 months with 10 men #VikingsLive http://t.co/MOSEMPlpWk http://t.co/9WGgUhOnPL

quote.text: Roskilde’s Viking Ship Museum built a 60-ft ship in 18 months with 10 men #VikingsLive http://t.co/MOSEMPlpWk http://t.co/9WGgUhOnPL
The Vikings mass produced these ships – an account of a Viking attack on Paris says the Seine appeared as 'a forest' #VikingsLive

image.caption: The dragon figureheads on Viking ships showed enemies a terrifying figure of fire and destruction #VikingsLive http://t.co/4hnAqUZbG9

quote.text: The dragon figureheads on Viking ships showed enemies a terrifying figure of fire and destruction #VikingsLive http://t.co/4hnAqUZbG9
Exhibition Curator Gareth Williams says Vikings travelled because inheritance laws were broke up the land and shrank wealth #VikingsLive
The best illustration of this interconnected world comes in the variety of objects from Viking sites #VikingsLive

image.caption: Silk was found in Dublin, probably from the Islamic Caliphate – not what you’d expect a Viking to wear #VikingsLive http://t.co/Nk6kfD3RU3

quote.text: Silk was found in Dublin, probably from the Islamic Caliphate – not what you’d expect a Viking to wear #VikingsLive http://t.co/Nk6kfD3RU3
.@Bettany_Hughes: the Vikings played a central part in the development of the Byzantine Empire #VikingsLive http://t.co/tRVPhjYiVG
The spread of Viking jewellery shows the extent of Viking influence but can’t be used to identify the ethnicity of their owners #VikingsLive
The last show at the Museum on Vikings was in 1980, at the height of the Cold War #VikingsLive
The subsequent opening of the former Soviet Union has provided many new discoveries #VikingsLive

image.caption: The Vale of York Hoard is a fascinating example of Viking emergency banking #VikingsLive http://t.co/cHzHeMIGQC

quote.text: The Vale of York Hoard is a fascinating example of Viking emergency banking #VikingsLive http://t.co/cHzHeMIGQC
The 700 individual items in the hoard were crammed into a liturgical cup and wrapped in lead pre burial #VikingsLive http://t.co/YKw6Fjzys0
Curator Gareth Williams helped unpack the cup – a Carolingian religious vessel #VikingsLive
The hoard includes Islamic and Scandinavian coins, Russian neck-rings and Irish Sea arm-rings, all in the magnificent cup #VikingsLive
The hoard provides examples of Viking traders and raiders, as well as appreciation for fine craftsmanship #VikingsLive
The cup could’ve been melted down for its precious metal, but was kept intact – Vikings appreciated good workmanship in others #VikingsLive
You can find out more about the extraordinary Vale of York Hoard here #VikingsLive http://t.co/86G4bttVDp

image.caption: Vikings used the sun, stars, colours of the sea and movements of the waves as natural aids to navigation #VikingsLive http://t.co/lcy5I2hwKN

quote.text: Vikings used the sun, stars, colours of the sea and movements of the waves as natural aids to navigation #VikingsLive http://t.co/lcy5I2hwKN
.@SirRKJ says he tried using a sun compass during his transatlantic voyage on a replica Viking ship #VikingsLive
Michael Wood says: early raids were for plunder: 'loot, treasure, slaves – you name it, they took it' #VikingsLive
Literary evidence of early expeditions suggests that raids were a few hundred Vikings at most #VikingsLive
New evidence from North Yorkshire suggests these infrequent Viking raiders soon became armies of many thousands #VikingsLive
In AD 793, Vikings marauders attacked a small monastery at Lindisfarne, beginning Britain's Viking Age #VikingsLive

image.caption: Curator Gareth Williams is now dressed as a 'fairly high status Viking' #VikingsLive http://t.co/tphhsWj3aZ

quote.text: Curator Gareth Williams is now dressed as a 'fairly high status Viking' #VikingsLive http://t.co/tphhsWj3aZ
Viking shields were made of wood, with a leather coating to help bind the planks, and a metal boss in their centre #VikingsLive
Normally this metal boss is all that survives, but there is one example of an entirely intact shield in the #VikingExhibition #VikingsLive
Viking armour was very hot and very heavy... #VikingsLive
The battle of Stamford Bridge in 1066 took place on such a hot day that the Norwegians decided to fight without armour #VikingsLive

image.caption: The sword was the ultimate Viking warrior status symbol #VikingsLive http://t.co/0LrGYy3ZtG

quote.text: The sword was the ultimate Viking warrior status symbol #VikingsLive http://t.co/0LrGYy3ZtG
Makers such as Ulfberht became the designer labels of their day #VikingsLive

image.caption: As with any successful designer, cheap knock offs soon followed #VikingsLive http://t.co/7NgXTttrqb

quote.text: As with any successful designer, cheap knock offs soon followed #VikingsLive http://t.co/7NgXTttrqb
Swords and the warriors who wielded them had distinctive looks and names #VikingsLive

image.caption: Some skeletons have been found with filed teeth #VikingsLive http://t.co/7DAfkYyN7P

quote.text: Some skeletons have been found with filed teeth #VikingsLive http://t.co/7DAfkYyN7P
Gareth: meeting that on the battlefield would have been terrifying! #VikingsLive
Great warriors achieve a place in Valhöll where dead warriors would drink and fight until Ragnarök – the end of the world #VikingsLive
What’s your Viking name? Try our app here http://t.co/Rhup7803ou

image.caption: In 2009 the dismembered skeletons of around 50 Vikings were discovered by archaeologists in Weymouth #VikingsLive http://t.co/840I9kLgeJ

quote.text: In 2009 the dismembered skeletons of around 50 Vikings were discovered by archaeologists in Weymouth #VikingsLive http://t.co/840I9kLgeJ
Isotope analysis has identified the people in the burial pit as Scandinavians – Vikings didn’t always win! #VikingsLive

image.caption: We’re now moving on to talk about women in the Viking world #VikingsLive http://t.co/tu2nJqw7bH

quote.text: We’re now moving on to talk about women in the Viking world #VikingsLive http://t.co/tu2nJqw7bH

image.caption: You can buy @JudithJesch’s Viking Poetry of Love and War here http://t.co/MBhgi9gGpj http://t.co/qJx1cqwK0O

quote.text: You can buy @JudithJesch’s Viking Poetry of Love and War here http://t.co/MBhgi9gGpj http://t.co/qJx1cqwK0O
.@Bettany_Hughes is talking to @JudithJesch about Viking women #VikingsLive

image.caption: Women were charged with safeguarding the home, conveying their status through decorative household items #VikingsLive http://t.co/cjJtgX6lvm

quote.text: Women were charged with safeguarding the home, conveying their status through decorative household items #VikingsLive http://t.co/cjJtgX6lvm
Viking women could also be sorceresses, witches and healers – important figures in the community #VikingsLive

image.caption: These strange objects have been interpreted as magical staffs used by sorceresses #VikingsLive http://t.co/iGiKwiHoVn

quote.text: These strange objects have been interpreted as magical staffs used by sorceresses #VikingsLive http://t.co/iGiKwiHoVn
Women also appeared in myths as Valkyries – choosers of the slain who would go to Valhalla #VikingsLive

image.caption: You can read more on @JudithJesch’s blog on Viking women here #VikingsLive http://t.co/HSDuEArD3O http://t.co/nH9xUc6P3y

quote.text: You can read more on @JudithJesch’s blog on Viking women here #VikingsLive http://t.co/HSDuEArD3O http://t.co/nH9xUc6P3y

image.caption: These shackles were just one of the brutal ways the Vikings secured there human plunder #VikingsLive http://t.co/0CdNmpJPlM

quote.text: These shackles were just one of the brutal ways the Vikings secured there human plunder #VikingsLive http://t.co/0CdNmpJPlM
You can read Project Curator Tom Williams’ blog on Vikings and slavery here http://t.co/czBGg7mF9f
Vikings founded kingdoms in Ireland, Northumbria and Normandy #VikingsLive
The Normans were originally Vikings and came to rule England as a whole after 1066 #VikingsLive

image.caption: Here’s Cnut, King of England 1016–1035, shown as a Christian warrior king in the Liber Vitae #VikingsLive http://t.co/jjVXUzVRIy

quote.text: Here’s Cnut, King of England 1016–1035, shown as a Christian warrior king in the Liber Vitae #VikingsLive http://t.co/jjVXUzVRIy

image.caption: Cnut controlled a great North Sea empire but the famous story of him and the sea probably isn’t true! #VikingsLive http://t.co/Q0FMa3Vdu7

quote.text: Cnut controlled a great North Sea empire but the famous story of him and the sea probably isn’t true! #VikingsLive http://t.co/Q0FMa3Vdu7
We’re now talking about the wide legacy of the Vikings #VikingsLive
.@Bettany_Hughes is talking to runes expert Martin Findell #VikingsLive

image.caption: The Hunterston Brooch is Celtic, with a Gaelic name in Viking runes – Britain's mixed heritage! #VikingsLive http://t.co/qiIZwuBHcw

quote.text: The Hunterston Brooch is Celtic, with a Gaelic name in Viking runes – Britain's mixed heritage! #VikingsLive http://t.co/qiIZwuBHcw
Bluetooth communication is named after Harald Bluetooth, King of Denmark and Norway #VikingsLive

image.caption: The Bluetooth symbol combines H and B in runes (for Harald Bluetooth) #VikingsLive http://t.co/FkKvM6L3U5 http://t.co/A3V6Kl96DU

quote.text: The Bluetooth symbol combines H and B in runes (for Harald Bluetooth) #VikingsLive http://t.co/FkKvM6L3U5 http://t.co/A3V6Kl96DU
You can find out more about runes in Martin Findell’s book #VikingsLive http://t.co/VwHTKqd3rv
You can even see our website in runes! Search here for ‘go berserk’ http://t.co/406mh4Ygp8 #VikingsLive
.@Bettany_Hughes is now talking to Jayne Carroll, expert in English place names #VikingsLive
The Vikings left their legacy in the English language – egg, sister, die, awkward and window are all Old Norse in origin #VikingsLive

image.caption: They also left their mark on place names: -thorpe, -by and -wick are all Viking in origin #VikingsLive http://t.co/pzzzXfSnI9

quote.text: They also left their mark on place names: -thorpe, -by and -wick are all Viking in origin #VikingsLive http://t.co/pzzzXfSnI9
You can search for Viking place names across the UK and Ireland here #VikingsLive http://t.co/uBmMXYHobE
.@Bettany_Hughes is talking to Turi King, expert in DNA analysis, about the Viking legacy in our genes #VikingsLive
Turi says it’s complicated(!), but we all have Viking somewhere in our family tree #VikingsLive

image.caption: Odin prepares for a newly dead warrior in Valhalla #VikingsLive http://t.co/Felifir4T4

quote.text: Odin prepares for a newly dead warrior in Valhalla #VikingsLive http://t.co/Felifir4T4
#onthisday 1,000 years ago the survivors of the Battle of Clontarf were burying their dead, some Irish, some Viking #VikingsLive
Warriors were buried with possessions and weapons, ready to wake every morning and fight again in Valhalla #VikingsLive

image.caption: #VikingsLive is coming to a close with a torch-lit boat burial re-enactment! http://t.co/UCbh4Qiuew

quote.text: #VikingsLive is coming to a close with a torch-lit boat burial re-enactment! http://t.co/UCbh4Qiuew
Neil MacGregor: the Vikings live vividly in our imaginations as few other cultures do #VikingsLive http://t.co/GMx29vdomO
@britishmuseum Where did the horned helmet myth come from? #VikingsLive
.@wild_ste Gareth says horned helmets were a Victorian invention, not worn by Vikings!
.@MeeMaa1 asked what contemporary Islamic writers had to say about Vikings
Gareth says the Islamic response to them was mixed. One called the Vikings 'the filthiest of God's creatures'...
We hope you enjoyed following #VikingsLive with us!
There’ll be encore screenings of #VikingsLive in the UK and Ireland in the next week, plus international screenings soon
Plus, don’t miss #VikingAdventures – a special film for families and schools in cinemas at the start of June http://t.co/7qpVlPz2Qi
Find out more about #VikingAdventures with @edpetrie and @SonaliShah here http://t.co/C2UIOZfbzo
#VikingsLive was bloody brilliant! Thanks @britishmuseum. Me and my mum loved it. We used to love reading about them when I was a kid.
Curators and museums are fantastic inspiring us all about the past #VikingsLive #VikingsRule well done @britishmuseum wonderful production
#VikingsLive was actually wonderful! Thank you very much @britishmuseum, thoroughly enjoyed it!
@britishmuseum #VikingsLive well done that was a great insight into the Viking in all of us - enjoyed by packed cinema @cineworld Yeovil
@britishmuseum excellent!! I loved every minute. Thank you from those of us who can't get to the exhibition, to see it :-D #VikingsLive
@britishmuseum #VikingsLive was a great success. Thank you for a great evening of informative and enjoyable Viking entertainment. Loved it!

image.caption: #VikingsLive was magnificent, despite Thor & his loud popcorn! Good to see my old sword again too @britishmuseum http://t.co/kwPfSmcjWJ

quote.text: #VikingsLive was magnificent, despite Thor & his loud popcorn! Good to see my old sword again too @britishmuseum http://t.co/kwPfSmcjWJ
@Bettany_Hughes #VikingsLive was absolutely brilliant! Congratulations to all involved both in front & behind camera @britishmuseum

story.embedcode: [View the story "#VikingsLive" on Storify]
